etymology.description: 二(二) (èr, "two") above 人(人) (rén, "person") = person lifting something high
etymology.interpretation: The character 亢(亢) (kàng, "high") visually represents a person standing with arms raised, symbolizing the idea of lifting or being elevated. The combination of two horizontal strokes above a person conveys the notion of height or reaching upwards.

examples.chinese: 他的情绪亢奋(他的情緒亢奮)。
山峰高耸(山峰高聳)，气势亢然(氣勢亢然)。
examples.english: The mountains tower high, and their momentum is exalted.
